project.teaser: We aim to contribute to the European Green Deal, the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the Horizon Europe objectives through the development of a Geological Service for Europe, which focuses on the planet itself: the earth beneath our feet. The subsurface holds...
project.objective: We aim to contribute to the European Green Deal, the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the Horizon Europe objectives through the development of a Geological Service for Europe, which focuses on the planet itself: the earth beneath our feet. The subsurface holds indispensable resources for European industries and opportunities to decarbonise our economy, but also requires careful management to preserve a healthy and safe living environment for Europe’s citizens. Structurally addressing the EU dimension in geological services is needed because the scale of many societally and economically relevant geological features exceeds that of individual countries. Addressing transnational and continental-scale problems requires innovation, standardisation, harmonisation as well as a shared vision. We aim to build the Geological Service for Europe based on Europe’s best practices and implement the Service with the backing of the Union. Existing geological surveys, the national custodians of geological information, have amassed huge legacies of data and information that are difficult to merge. This project will continue the harmonisation and standardisation effort initiated in earlier projects. We aim to create joint services that can support acceleration of the energy and climate transitions, as well as a larger critical mass of intra-European cooperation through convergence of our research agendas, as key steps to increase the amount and quality of results we are aiming for. A common thread in this project is innovation in ways in which subsurface information is conceptualised, organised, visualised, delivered and translated to the needs of a wide range of audiences, and the methodologies to achieve this. Building on the groundwork laid in the GeoERA program, we will scale up and out, not only scientifically, but also in involving national stakeholders in the network, in order to create support and eventually obtain a mandate for a European Service on a permanent basis.
project.title: A Geological Service for Europe
project.keywords: Critical Raw Materials, Sustainable Geo-Energy, Groundwater, Coastal Vulnerability, Offshore Windparks, Information Infrastructure, Geological Services

article.title: A unified platform for accelerating transition towards clean energy

result.title: European groundwater monitoring database v1
result.description: Initial European groundwater monitoring databaseDeliverable refers to Task 4.1 (i) and (ii) and will contain a relational database holding metadata on sites (observation boreholes); groundwater level and standardised level time series data; summary statistics of trend analyses of the time series; and capacity for temporal storage. The database is accessible and searchable via EGDI supported web-map service

result.description: Communications Dissemination and Exploitation Strategy & Action Plan designed by WP1 in collaboration with WP8 lead and WP8 task leads and with input from the management board to ensure a common understanding and approach towards internal and external communication, dissemination & exploitation activities across the entire consortium.

result.title: Project Management Plan v2
result.description: Updated Project Management Plan following analysis and feedback of the first reporting period, to take into account any adjustments to managment planning and practices deemed necessary, including any changes in the GANTT chart in case of delayed deliverables.

result.title: Report on communication and dissemination activities v1
result.description: Initial Report on communication and dissemination activitiesAnnual reports will be prepared on the communication and dissemination activities carried out. Based on CDE Action Plans (prepared under WP1 in M3, M24 and M48), the achievement of target values will be monitored. Qualitative and quantitative analyses of communication and dissemination activities will be prepared and included in the reports. Previous annual reports must serve as a basis for the preparation of subsequent CDE Action Plans.

result.description: Initial Report on networking and clustering actions, rules and recommendations for future EGDI operation

result.title: "The future Pan-European Atlas for Sustainable Geo-Energy Capacities. The #GSEU project."
Inventory of geological maps, map data sets, models, and services in the EGDI Metadata Catalogue v1
result.description: Initial Inventory of geological maps, map data sets, models, and services in the EGDI Metadata CatalogueThis delivery refers to Task 6.1 and will include metadata templates for printed geological maps, map data sets, geological 3D-models and web services. Metadata will be collected accross Europe and made available in the existing EGDI Metadata Catalogue following FAIR data priciples. Templates, instructions for their application and the resulting metadata collection will be documented in a report.

result.title: Report on stakeholder engagement meetings, trainings & workshops v1
result.description: Initial Report on stakeholder engagement meetings, trainings & workshops.Report on engagement and dissemination activities that have been tailored to meet the needs of a broad range of stakeholders (researchers and academia, policy makers and private sector), including trainings modules, meetings and workshops which are seen as a key medium for stakeholder engagement, and the outcomes of these events and actions.

result.title: Report on GSO’s positioning of on subsurface-related marine geological information, including a data service and management roadmap v1
result.description: Initial Report on GSO’s positioning of on subsurface-related marine geological information, including a data service and management roadmapReport on GSO’s positioning on subsurface-related marine geological information, including a data service and management roadmap. Workshop and subsequent whitepaper with guidance on strengthening our collective position as a key service centre for subsurface-related marine-geological information. The whitepaper will be embedded in the SRIA and disseminated on relevant EU and national platforms. It will connect WP5 to existing long-term EU as well as global programmes, directives and infrastructures (including the European Marine Observation and Data network). (Task 5.3) (M12,42)

result.title: Assessing Current Coastal Subsidence at Continental Scale: Insights From Europe Using the European Ground Motion Service

details.authors: Thiéblemont, Rémi; Le Cozannet, Gonéri; Nicholls, Robert; Rohmer, Jérémy; Wöppelmann, Guy; Raucoules, Daniel; de Michele, Marcello; Toimil, Alexandra; Lincke, Daniel

result.title: Catalogue of aquifers for drought and floods v1
result.description: Initial Catalogue of aquifers for drought and floodsDeliverable refers to Task 4.1 (iii) and will include the selection and description of an index for a preliminary assessment of groundwater pumping resilience and a catalogue/database of strategically important and potentially vulnerable aquifers based on the value adopted by this index

result.title: Report on communication and dissemination activities v2
result.description: Updated Report on communication and dissemination activitiesAnnual reports will be prepared on the communication and dissemination activities carried out. Based on CDE Action Plans (prepared under WP1 in M3, M24 and M48), the achievement of target values will be monitored. Qualitative and quantitative analyses of communication and dissemination activities will be prepared and included in the reports. Previous annual reports must serve as a basis for the preparation of subsequent CDE Action Plans.

result.title: EU ICE SRM organizational scheme, business plan, working plan and partner & expert register v1
result.description: Initial EU ICE SRM organizational scheme, business plan, working plan and partner & expert register.The deliverable will present the provisional organisation scheme for the EU International Center of Excellence on Sustainable Resource Management and a proposal of its bussiness and 5y working plan. Register of partners and UNFC/UNMRS experts will be included.

result.title: Report on methodology and guidance for EU-level data harmonization with UNFC v2
result.description: Final Report on methodology and guidance for EU-level data harmonization with UNFC.The first part of this report will summarize available methodologies for using UNFC by project partners based on previous project results and further national developments; the second part will introduce the joint, easiest methodology of using UNFC for primary and secondary raw materials (mainly mining wastes). Both first level UNFC application and more detailed second level guidance will be shown.Risk can be identified in case partners/experts are not active from all or at least most competent countries but all EU-funded project results dealing with UNFC are available. The guidance will be discussed in the ICE and will contribute to the proper raw materials data harmonization in the EGDI.

result.title: Methodology and protocol for assessing groundwater quality v1
result.description: Initial Methodology and protocol for assessing groundwater qualityDeliverable refers to Task 4.2 (i) and will propose a method allowing the determination of groundwater quality combining results of monitoring data and geochemical processes related to litho/geological context. The conceptual understanding of groundwater quality variability across Europe will allow the extension of the information in areas not covered by monitoring stations

result.title: EGDI data hub feeding FAIR EGDI data into surrounding EU information infrastructures v1
result.description: Initial EGDI data hub feeding FAIR EGDI data into surrounding EU information infrastructuresWill present a framework with prototype examples for the requirements to deliver the interfacing between EGDI and other infrastructures at month 15 and go on to deliver this hub at month 54. This will engage with international best practices and interoperability standards to ensure EGDI delivers world leading FAIR geoscience data services to the INSPIRE Geoportal, RMIS, OneGeology Portal and EPOS Research Infrastructure at a minimum.

result.title: Project Management Plan v1
result.description: Project Management Plan with detailed overview of the work plan and monitoring safeguards, operational & executive management strucute, and GANTT chart.

result.title: Project Quality Plan
result.description: Project Quality Plan to ensure quality controls are in place throughout the project duration, including for example the use of key performance indicators.

result.title: Online knowledge and competence hub supporting the appraisal and evaluation of SGEC’s in Europe v1
result.description: Initial Online knowledge and competence hub supporting the appraisal and evaluation of SGEC’s in Europe: Digital portal with information & tools supporting the appraisal and evaluation of SGEC’s in Europe - Organized by theme, searchable and structured by vocabularies (EGDI embedded). Factsheets and guidelines for information uses and implementation in decision processes, UNFC classification, and other useful contents supporting knowledge transfer

result.title: EGDI multifunctional 2D/3D decision-support module v1
result.description: Initial EGDI multifunctional 2D/3D decision-support moduleEEGDI multifunctional 2D/3D decision-support module (including WP9 ‘how to’ guidance) with filtering capability for vulnerability classification (onshore-offshore) and to optimise windfarm siting within the context of complementarity (win-win) and competing use of space, using agreed input standards and protocols, documented as WP9 wiki entries. (Task 5.4) (M18,54).

result.title: Immobilization of Rare Earth Elements and Yttrium (REY) by Iron (Bio)Precipitation in Acid Sulfate Waters from El Bierzo (Spain)

details.authors: Blanca Rincón-Tomás; Francisco Javier González; Enrique López-Pamo; Esther Santofimia

result.title: GSE Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA) v1
result.description: This document will be an update to the 2021 GSE Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA). The original document will be expanded to take into account more stakeholder feedback on the research & innovation gaps in relation to priority actions needed to support the European Green Deal and UN Sustainable Development Goals, amongst other pressing policy priorities at EU level.

result.title: Technical Report on the feasibility and functional structure of the Geological Service for Europe v1_DRAFT
result.description: First draft Technical Report on the feasibility and functional structure of the Geological Service for Europe outlining potential operational, governance and funding models.

result.title: Deep-sea minerals: a big challenge for the world sustainable future

details.authors: González Sanz, Francisco Javier; GEOMAR Research Group
details.journalTitle: th Meeting of the Mineralogical Society of Poland 28th Meeting of the Petrology group of the Mineralogical Society of Poland

result.title: Report on methodology and guidance for EU-level data harmonization with UNFC v1
result.description: Initial Report on methodology and guidance for EU-level data harmonization with UNFC.The first part of this report will summarize available methodologies for using UNFC by project partners based on previous project results and further national developments; the second part will introduce the joint, easiest methodology of using UNFC for primary and secondary raw materials (mainly mining wastes). Both first level UNFC application and more detailed second level guidance will be shown.Risk can be identified in case partners/experts are not active from all or at least most competent countries but all EU-funded project results dealing with UNFC are available. The guidance will be discussed in the ICE and will contribute to the proper raw materials data harmonization in the EGDI.

result.title: European onshore CRM resource evaluation v1
result.description: Initial European onshore CRM resource evaluation This deliverable is organized in two parts that are: 1) a database and report on CRM deposits in Europe, that will be extracted from an updated and completed MIN4EU database, in order to fill identified gaps (in terms of geographic coverage and content) (D2.3, M24), and 2) an updated database and report on CRM deposits in Europe with regional focuses on geological potential of most prospective areas for a selection of CRM (D2.3, M48).

result.title: Prototypes for EU wide visualization of groundwater quality patterns v1
result.description: Initial Prototypes for EU wide visualization of groundwater quality patternsDeliverable refers to Task 4.2 (ii) and to linking the pressure to the potential presence of selected contaminant in groundwater at EU scale to be done through a chain of data processing tested during Task 4.2 (ii) for pilot areas and selected dissolved elements. A matrix linking pressure and impact will be combined to the geochemical pattern developed in D4.4. and compared to monitoring data.

result.title: Report on added value of geology for coastal vulnerability assessments v1
result.description: Initial Report on added value of geology for coastal vulnerability assessmentsReport on the added value of geology for coastal vulnerability assessments, covering issues related to concentrated pollutants and nutrients submarine and coastal groundwater discharge (Task 5.1a), to vertical ground displacements and their effects to sea level changes (Task 5.1b) and the coastal evolution in large time scales (decadal to centennial) and sea level rise impacts (Task 5.1c). Draft version at M24; final version: M36.

result.title: Science of the Total Environment

details.authors: A J, Collados-Lara; D, Pulido-Velazquez; L G B, Ruiz; M C, Pegalajar; E, Pardo-Igúzquiza; L, Baena-Ruiz

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Data Management Plan will be developed in collaboration with a data policy committee, coordinating across WPs all the work related to the data management and intellectual property management.

result.title: The Geological Service for Europe (GSEU) project

details.authors: Jérémie Melleton, Francesco Pizzocolo, Guillaume Bertrand
details.journalTitle: Réunion des Sciences de la Terre (RST)

result.title: European offshore CRM resource evaluation v1
result.description: Initial European offshore CRM resource evaluationThis deliverable is organized in two parts that are: 1) a database and report on the principal types of seabed mineral deposits in pan-European seas and their genetic models, with especial emphasis in those with economic potential and linked to the new technologies and energy transition (D2.4; M24); and 2) a report of the present-day exploration and exploitation status in terms of regulation, legislation, environmental impacts, exploitation and future directions in the international and European framework (D2.4; M48)

result.title: Conceptual & physical model for multiscale geological data in 2&3D v1
result.description: Initial Conceptual & physical model for multiscale geological data in 2&3DThis delivery refers to Task 6.2.1. Based on the „Structural Framework“ (developed in GeoERA-project GeoConnect3d) and other existing data models we will develop a GIS-based, conceptual as well as physical, EGDI-based data model, which is able to take up multiscale geological data in 2D and 3D. The conceptual and physical data model will be documented in a report.

result.title: Progress and ambitions of the European Geological Survey Organisations in delivering harmonised subsurface data as the basis for informed energy transition policy.

result.teaser: The main general objective of this project is to establish a Geological Service for Europe, which we envisage as a point of entry into a permanent collaborative network of European geological survey organizations. Our long-term ambition is to provide European institutions...

result.title: Geothermal resources of Hungary: a play-based review

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
